asp.name: mtab
asp.inputdescription:
This ASP expects a measurement graph path and a node identifier as arguments on the command line. The node identified must have target type file_target_type and address space path_address_space to indicate the target directory. The asp will parse the /etc/mtab file using getmntent() function to record the file system description data.
This ASP does not consume any input from stdin.
asp.outputdescription:
This ASP produces a mtab_measurement_type containing mount information in /etc/mtab. The ASP then marshals this data and attaches it to the node passed as input.
This ASP produces no output on stdout.
asp.example:
Running mtabasp with graph configured by graph-shell
Terminal 1 (use graph-shell to create graph and insert node) $ ./graph-shell > types /opt/maat/lib/libmaat_basetypes.so register_types > new Graph created at /tmp/maatgraphs8OCgV graph(/tmp/maatgraphdX0UH4)> add-node 3e9 5f5f5f5f /etc/mtab 0000000000000000
Terminal 2 (run asp) $ ./mtabasp /tmp/maatgraphdX0UH4 0
Terminal 1 (use graph-shell to display node contents) graph(/tmp/maatgraphdX0UH4)> node-type 0 file 000003e9 graph(/tmp/maatgraphdX0UH4)> ls-data 0 abcdabcd: mtab graph(/tmp/maatgraphdX0UH4)> cat-data 0 abcdabcd Filesystem Name: /dev/sda1 Dir: / Type:ext4 Opts: rw,errors=remount-ro Freq: 0 PassNo: 0
Filesystem Name: proc Dir: /proc Type:proc Opts: rw,noexec,nosuid,nodev Freq: 0 PassNo: 0
Filesystem Name: sysfs Dir: /sys Type:sysfs Opts: rw,noexec,nosuid,nodev Freq: 0 PassNo: 0
etc...

capability.target_desc: An instance of target type, which describes atributes of the target file
capability.address_desc: An instance of address type that decribes the file address, for this asp it is a path. This includes file information such as address, device major/minor, file size, node, and full name.
capability.measurement_desc: An instance of measurement type that describes the Mount Table Data, including mount points, file system types, and mount options
